apache2.synopsis: The Apache HTTP Server is a free and open-source cross-platform web server software.

bash.synopsis: <abbr title="Bourne-Again shell">Bash</abbr> is a shell program and command language supported by the <abbr title="Free Software Foundation">FSF</abbr> and first developed for the <abbr title="GNU is Not Unix">GNU</abbr> Project by Brian Fox.

blender.synopsis: Blender is a free and open-source 3D computer graphics software tool set.

c.synopsis: C is a general-purpose programming language. It was created in the 1970s by Dennis Ritchie and Ken Thompson. Despite its age, it remains very widely used and influential.

chartier--le-goff-marius.synopsis: Marius Chartier--Le Goff est né en 2005 et est étudiant en BUT informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Il souhaite continuer ses études jusqu'au titre d'ingénieur.

cities-skylines.synopsis: Cities: Skylines is a 2015 city-building game developed by Colossal Order and published by Paradox Interactive. The game is a single-player open-ended city-building simulation.

cpp.synopsis: C++ is a high-level, general-purpose programming language created by Danish computer scientist Bjarne Stroustrup.

csharp.synopsis: C# is a general-purpose high-level programming language supporting multiple paradigms.

css.synopsis: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for specifying the presentation and styling of a document written in a markup language such as HTML or XML.

csv.synopsis: Comma-separated values (CSV) is a text file format that uses commas to separate values, and newlines to separate records.

docker.synopsis: Docker is a set of platform as a service (PaaS) products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

dotnet.synopsis: The .NET platform is a free and open-source, managed computer software framework for Windows, Linux, and macOS operating systems.

doxygen.synopsis: Doxygen is a documentation generator and static analysis tool for software source trees. When used as a documentation generator, Doxygen extracts information from specially-formatted comments within the code. When used for analysis, Doxygen uses its parse tree to generate diagrams and charts of the code structure. Doxygen can cross reference documentation and code, so that the reader of a document can easily refer to the actual code.

ebnf.synopsis: Extended Backus-Naur Form (EBNF) is a <abbr title="Backus-Naur Form">BNF</abbr> extension created by Niklaus Wirth in 1996. This language expresses formal grammars, which are notably used in compiler design.

figma.synopsis: Figma is a collaborative web application for interface design.

github.synopsis: GitHub is a developer platform that allows developers to create, store, manage and share their code.

gloomaps.synopsis: GlooMaps is a simple online visual sitemap tool.

html.synopsis: <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr> is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser. It defines the content and structure of web content.

inno-setup.synopsis: Inno Setup is a free software script-driven installation system created in Delphi by Jordan Russell. The first version was released in 1997.

java.synopsis: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

javascript.synopsis: JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language and core technology of the Web, alongside HTML and CSS.

json.synopsis: <abbr title="JavaScript Object Notation">JSON</abbr> is an open standard file format and data interchange format that uses human-readable text to store and transmit data objects consisting of attribute–value pairs and arrays (or other serializable values).

kervadec-matteo.synopsis: Mattéo Kervadec est un étudiant en 1ère année de BUT en filière Informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Il a un baccalauréat avec les spécialités Mathématiques et NSI obtenu au lycée Sainte-Anne à Sainte-Anne-d'Auray. Il est passionné par le tennis et le cinéma autant dans les films que le jeu vidéo. Il porte aussi un intérêt pour le développement de logiciels informatiques.

lua.synopsis: Lua is a lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded use in applications.

markdown.synopsis: Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor.

minecraft.synopsis: Minecraft is a 2011 sandbox game developed by Mojang Studios and originally released in 2009.

mysql.synopsis: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

pascal.synopsis: Pascal is an imperative and procedural programming language, designed by Niklaus Wirth as a small, efficient language intended to encourage good programming practices using structured programming and data structuring.

pgsql.synopsis: PostgreSQL, also known as Postgres, is a free and open-source relational database management system.

php.synopsis: <abbr title="Personal Homepage">PHP</abbr> is a general-purpose scripting language geared towards web development, created in 1993.

powershell.synopsis: PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management program from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and the associated scripting language.

python.synopsis: Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.

replit.synopsis: Replit is an American start-up and an online IDE that allows creating online programming projects called repls.

rolland-stanislas.synopsis: Stanislas Rolland est âgé de 18 ans et est actuellement en première année de BUT informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Avant de rejoindre cette formation, il a obtenu son baccalauréat mention assez bien avec les spécialités Mathématiques et NSI.

sass.synopsis: <abbr title="Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets">Sass</abbr> is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS.

scheme.synopsis: Scheme is a dialect of the Lisp family of programming languages. Scheme was created during the 1970s at the <abbr title="MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory">MIT AI</abbr> Lab).

smalltalk.synopsis: Smalltalk is a purely object oriented programming language (OOP) that was originally created in 1972 for educational use.

sql.synopsis: <abbr title="Structured Query Language">SQL</abbr> is a domain-specific language used to manage data, especially in relational database management systems.

sql-workbench.synopsis: SQLite is a database engine written in the C programming language.

sqlite.synopsis: SQL Workbench/J is a DBMS-independent, cross-platform SQL query tool.

svg.synopsis: <abbr title="Scalable Vector Graphics">SVG</abbr> is an XML-based vector image format for defining two-dimensional graphics, having support for interactivity and animation.

tkinter.synopsis: Tkinter is a Python binding to the Tk GUI toolkit. It is the standard Python interface to the Tk GUI toolkit.

toe-paolo.synopsis: Paolo Vito Toé est un étudiant en BUT Informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Son parcours le pousse à s'améliorer en permanence, car l'informatique est une de ses grandes passions. Né aux États-Unis et ayant grandi dans plusieurs pays différents, il est suis aussi passionné par les cultures étrangères. Outre ses études, il est passionné par la lecture et la création de jeux.

visual-paradigm.synopsis: Visual Paradigm is a versatile software development tool that provides a range of features to support different aspects of software development life cycle (SDLC). It's primarily known for its UML (Unified Modeling Language) modeling tools, which help developers, architects, and analysts to visualize, specify, construct, and document software systems.

visual-studio.synopsis: Visual Studio is an <abbr title="Integrated Development Environment">IDE</abbr> developed by Microsoft. It is used to develop computer programs.

vs-code.synopsis: Visual Studio Code, also commonly referred to as VS Code,[9] is a source-code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux, macOS and web browsers.

winforms.synopsis: Windows Forms is a free and open-source graphical class library included as a part of Microsoft .NET, .NET Framework or Mono.

wpf.synopsis: <abbr title="Windows Presentation Foundation">WPF</abbr> is a free and open-source user interface framework for Windows-based desktop applications.

xml.synopsis: XML is a markup language and file format for storing, transmitting, and reconstructing arbitrary data.

zig.synopsis: Zig is an imperative, general-purpose, statically typed, compiled system programming language designed by Andrew Kelley in 2015 as a successor to C.
